alert.note: Alert for Northern and Central Idaho Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 05 at 4:30PM MDT until September 07 at 11:00PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR POOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY RECOVERY TUESDAY NIGHT FOLLOWED BY WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY WEDNESDAY... * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 101 Northern and Central Idaho Panhandle (Zone 101). * Winds: Southwest 10 to 15 mph with gusts 25 mph. Localized ridge top gusts to 30 mph. * Timing: Tuesday evening through Wednesday evening. * Relative Humidities: 20 to 25 percent lowlands and 25 to 35 percent mountains. * Temperatures: Around 90 in the lowlands and upper 70s and 80s in the mountains. * Impacts: Poor humidity recovery overnight may cause high elevation fires to burn actively through the night. Gusty winds during the day time could cause current fires to spread.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
